column4: Tesla says supplier discount request was for ongoing projects
column5: Tesla said on Monday that it had asked a small number of suppliers to cut prices on ongoing  long-term projects to improve its future cash flow  after a media report about a discount request sent shares of Tesla down as much as 6.6 percent. | Video

column4: UPDATE 3-Tesla says supplier discount request was for ongoing projects
column5: July 23 Tesla said on Monday that it had asked a small number of suppliers to cut prices on ongoing  long-term projects to improve its future cash flow  after a media report about a discount request sent shares of Tesla down as much as 6.6 percent.

column4: U.S. to propose revoking Calif ability to set vehicle emissions rules  mandate EVs -- source
column5: WASHINGTON  July 23 The Trump administration is expected to propose revoking California's ability to set state vehicle emissions rules and mandate electric vehicles as early as later this week  a source briefed on the matter said.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall Street to open flat; manufacturing  tech earnings in focus
column5: * Futures: Dow and S&P flat  Nasdaq dips 0.22 pct (Adds analyst comment; updates details  prices)

column4: Tesla shares drop after report on supplier talks
column5: July 23 Shares of Tesla Inc fell more than 4 percent in trading before the bell on Monday  after a report that the electric car maker has turned to some suppliers for a refund of previously made payments in a bid to turn a profit.

column4: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - July 23
column5: July 23 The following are the top stories in the Wall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column4: CORRECTED-Wall St Week Ahead-Wall St braces for tariff fallout as S&P 500 companies report
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  July 20 Tariffs are starting to bite big manufacturers and Wall Street could get another bout of caution and uncertainty from major industrial companies when a swath of reports comes in over the next week.
